statement.tex: \text{Let $A=Q\times Q$, where Q is the set of all} \\ \text{rational numbers, and * be a binary operation} \\ \text{defined on A as } \\ (a, b)*(c, d)=(ac, b+ad), \forall \left(a, b\right)\left(c, d\right) \in A \\ Find \\ \text{(i) the identity element in A.} \\ \text{(ii) the invertible element of A.}

step.context: \text{If the identity element is the pair $I (i, j) \in A$,} \\ \text{by definition of identity element } \\ (a, b)*(i, j) = (a, b) = (i, j)*(a, b). \\ \text{What are i and j?}
step.reason: I(i, j) \in A \\ \text{Consider }(a, b)*(i, j) = (a, b) \\ \begin{align} \implies &(ai, b+aj) = (a, b) \\ \implies &ai = a, b+aj=b \\ \implies &a=1, b=0 \end{align} \\ \text{Consider }(i, j)(a, b) = (a, b) \\ \begin{align} \implies &(ai, b+aj) = (a, b) \\ \implies &ai = a, b+aj=b \\ \implies &a=1, b=0 \end{align} \\ \therefore {\bf\text{identity element} (1, 0).} \\

step.context: \text{If the invertible element is the pair $L (l, m) \in A$,} \\ \text{by definition of identity element } \\ (a, b)*(l, m) = (1, 0) = (l, m)*(a, b) \\ \text{What are l and m?}
